page.title: 13EDUCATION
page.content: {THE CEREMONY OF CUTTING THE TURF We all set off that morning when the birds began to sing, To see the new foundations the builders were to bring. We got there at last,hip-hip-hooray, The grass rippling as a patch of sea, Around there was a boundary line to mark off where the school was to be. Suddenly, ouch! ouch! ouch! The place was full of nettles, Luckily there were dock leaves to help us get more settled. Because the Mayor is here at last we all shout out for joy, He walks up very stately except for stumbling over a boy. Father Goodman, our Rector then made a quiet little speech, The Mayor dug the turf and said"Built for people to teach."{-by LOUISA PEAD {aged 11 years.Written on May 1st.1985
